solution_line_template: The t-shirt costs $10 more than the socks, so it costs ${socks_price} + ${tshirt_more_than_socks} = ${tshirt_price}.
The jeans are twice the price of the shirt, so they cost {jeans_multiplier} * ${tshirt_price} = $<<{jeans_multiplier}*{tshirt_price}={jeans_price}>>{jeans_price}.
